instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Imac 820 2784 A , 1 beep = no RAM installed
threads.message:
Hey guys, 

This Imac 820 2784 A, beeps. i think is a no ram installed.. i switch 3 times memory rams 10600S, 8500S, and 8gb 1333... and dont top beeping.. 

how have i look?

threads.title: Imac 820 2784 A , 1 beep = no RAM installed
threads.message: Memory should be PC3-10600..... Try one slot at a time....

threads.title: Imac 820 2784 A , 1 beep = no RAM installed
threads.message:
i try in every slot with a PC3-10600 and don't work .. 

When i put the charger in the machine turn's on without push button. bios problem ?

threads.title: Imac 820 2784 A , 1 beep = no RAM installed
Imac 820 2784 A , 1 beep = no RAM installed
threads.message: Not sure on the exact models, but some iMacs need 2 slots filled to work. Try with 2 known good 10600 RAM sticks in left and right slots.

threads.title: Imac 820 2784 A , 1 beep = no RAM installed
threads.message: já mudou 2 sabe boa 10600 Ram como você disse. eu não sei o que fazer ... fuking problema como merda.
